note.p: Burial: In the antechapel at Wadham, Oxford
Education: Wadham College, Oxford; BA (1723), MA (1726); Christ Church, Oxford; BD (1759)

Career: Ordained deacon (1725), priest (1727); rector of St Peter-le-Bailey, Oxford (1728); Fellow of Wadham (1729-1743); Chaplain to the English Factory at Leghorn (1729); travelled to Florence (1733), Venice, Vienna and Pressburg; returned to Oxford; Prebendary of St Asaph (1743); Fellow of Christ Church (1745); Keeper of the Oxford University Archives (1767-1777)
Proposers: James or Richard Bradley; Edmond Halley; William Jones
References: Trevor Shaw, 'John Swinton, FRS, Identified as the Author of a 1734 Travel Journal' in NR 1999 vol 53 pp 295-304, plate
